page.title: 01Summary
page.content: This area includes the South East corner of{Dorchester,}the county market town of Dorset. It extends East and South to include the valley of the {Winterborne}river. Beside the river are water meadows where cows graze, whilst on the sloping hillsides cereal crops are grown. South East Dorchester is mainly residential, but it has 6 of the 9 schools in the town and most of the recreational facilities. The mild climate and the outstanding beauty of the area attract visitors who also come to see archeological sites in the area.{Thomas Hardy}and{William Barnes} are both buried here, making it a place of pilgrimage for literary enthusiasts.
